Q2.2 Response: ownership, privacy, ethical, environmental concerns Difficulty in disproving illegal sourcing/training.

Ai generated art aims to be similar based on art that was collected from others Since AI uses collected data to "create" a new image, it could use very exact details from a human's work of art and "copy" it. Also the use of AI that can generate images in seconds, renders human artists useless. Anyone can upload pictures to train AI. This could mean someone stealing an artist's art without their consent and using it for the AI model.
